DataElement.preferredName: Patient Therapy Early Discontinue Reason Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: End or discontinuation of a patient/participant's therapy before originally planned._Category of reasons for a patient/participant not receiving treatment from a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: End or discontinuation of a patient/participant's therapy before originally planned.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: At or near the beginning of a period of time or course of events.:Discontinued; stopped permanently or temporarily.

Concepts.definition: At or near the beginning of a period of time or course of events.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Category of reasons for a patient/participant not receiving treatment from a clinical trial.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Study Lead Organization Study Terminated

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Study Lead Organization Study Terminated
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organization responsible for the overall scientific and administrative coordination, study monitoring, and data management activities of a particular clinical trial.: A clinical study status designating the study has been stopped prematurely and will not resume. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

Concepts.definition: An organization responsible for the overall scientific and administrative coordination, study monitoring, and data management activities of a particular clinical trial.
A clinical study status designating the study has been stopped prematurely and will not resume. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The loss or lack of continuation of follow-up after a study has officially closed.  See Follow-up.

Concepts.definition: The loss or lack of continuation of subject participation after a study has officially closed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

Concepts.definition: When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: Modification; the act of making something different.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Modification; the act of making something different.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in apoptosis, inflammation, septic shock, and wound healing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM definitions to reflect change in NCIt concept definition. mc 10/31/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Physician; a licensed medical practitioner.: A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

Concepts.definition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.10.28 Added apostrophe in 'patient's' for ticket request CADSR0001637. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI): Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Concepts.definition: Processes that involve and promote formation of more mature organs, organ systems, or organisms; general development. (NCI)
Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failing to satisfy an established set of qualifying measures.: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

Concepts.definition: Failing to satisfy an established set of qualifying measures.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
